intro: Torreya grandis var. dielsii, commonly known as the Chinese torreya, is a rare evergreen tree native to southern China. It belongs to the family Taxaceae and is characterized by its narrow, needle-like leaves and conical shape. The plant produces small, reddish berries that are an important food source for various bird species. It thrives in temperate climates with high humidity and well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat destruction, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
